model.dbt_tags_test.customers.name: customers
model.dbt_tags_test.customers.description: This table has basic information about a customer, as well as some derived facts based on a customer's orders

customer_id.name: customer_id
customer_id.description: This is a unique identifier for a customer

model.dbt_tags_test.customers.raw_code:
with customers as (

    select * from {{ ref('stg_customers') }}

),

orders as (

    select * from {{ ref('stg_orders') }}

),

payments as (

    select * from {{ ref('stg_payments') }}

),

customer_orders as (

        select
        customer_id,

        min(order_date) as first_order,
        max(order_date) as most_recent_order,
        count(order_id) as number_of_orders
    from orders

    group by customer_id

),

customer_payments as (

    select
        orders.customer_id,
        sum(amount) as total_amount

    from payments

    left join orders on
         payments.order_id = orders.order_id

    group by orders.customer_id

),

final as (

    select
        customers.customer_id,
        customers.first_name,
        customers.last_name,
        customer_orders.first_order,
        customer_orders.most_recent_order,
        customer_orders.number_of_orders,
        customer_payments.total_amount as customer_lifetime_value

    from customers

    left join customer_orders
        on customers.customer_id = customer_orders.customer_id

    left join customer_payments
        on  customers.customer_id = customer_payments.customer_id

)

select * from final

model.dbt_tags_test.stg_payments.name: stg_payments
model.dbt_tags_test.stg_payments.raw_code:
with source as (

    {#-
    Normally we would select from the table here, but we are using seeds to load
    our data in this project
    #}
    select * from {{ ref('raw_payments') }}

),

renamed as (

    select
        id as payment_id,
        order_id,
        payment_method,

        -- `amount` is currently stored in cents, so we convert it to dollars
        amount / 100 as amount

    from source

)

select * from renamed

model.dbt_tags_test.orders.name: orders
model.dbt_tags_test.orders.description: This table has basic information about orders, as well as some derived facts based on payments

order_id.name: order_id
order_id.description: This is a unique identifier for an order

customer_id.name: customer_id
customer_id.description: Foreign key to the customers table

order_date.name: order_date
order_date.description: Date (UTC) that the order was placed

credit_card_amount.name: credit_card_amount
credit_card_amount.description: Amount of the order (AUD) paid for by credit card

coupon_amount.name: coupon_amount
coupon_amount.description: Amount of the order (AUD) paid for by coupon

bank_transfer_amount.name: bank_transfer_amount
bank_transfer_amount.description: Amount of the order (AUD) paid for by bank transfer

gift_card_amount.name: gift_card_amount
gift_card_amount.description: Amount of the order (AUD) paid for by gift card

model.dbt_tags_test.stg_orders.name: stg_orders
model.dbt_tags_test.stg_orders.raw_code:
with source as (

    {#-
    Normally we would select from the table here, but we are using seeds to load
    our data in this project
    #}
    select * from {{ ref('raw_orders') }}

),

renamed as (

    select
        id as order_id,
        user_id as customer_id,
        order_date,
        status

    from source

)

select * from renamed

select * from renamed

macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.name: snowflake__get_catalog
snowflake__get_catalog_relations
snowflake__get_catalog_tables_sql
macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.macro_sql:
{% macro snowflake__get_catalog_tables_sql(information_schema) -%}
    select
        table_catalog as "table_database",
        table_schema as "table_schema",
        table_name as "table_name",
        coalesce(table_type, 'DYNAMIC TABLE') as "table_type",
        comment as "table_comment",

        -- note: this is the _role_ that owns the table
        table_owner as "table_owner",

        'Clustering Key' as "stats:clustering_key:label",
        clustering_key as "stats:clustering_key:value",
        'The key used to cluster this table' as "stats:clustering_key:description",
        (clustering_key is not null) as "stats:clustering_key:include",

        'Row Count' as "stats:row_count:label",
        row_count as "stats:row_count:value",
        'An approximate count of rows in this table' as "stats:row_count:description",
        (row_count is not null) as "stats:row_count:include",

        'Approximate Size' as "stats:bytes:label",
        bytes as "stats:bytes:value",
        'Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake' as "stats:bytes:description",
        (bytes is not null) as "stats:bytes:include",

        'Last Modified' as "stats:last_modified:label",
        to_varchar(convert_timezone('UTC', last_altered), 'yyyy-mm-dd HH24:MI'||'UTC') as "stats:last_modified:value",
        'The timestamp for last update/change' as "stats:last_modified:description",
        (last_altered is not null and table_type='BASE TABLE') as "stats:last_modified:include"
    from {{ information_schema }}.tables
{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.name: snowflake__get_catalog_columns_sql
macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.macro_sql:
{% macro snowflake__get_catalog_columns_sql(information_schema) -%}
    select
        table_catalog as "table_database",
        table_schema as "table_schema",
        table_name as "table_name",

        column_name as "column_name",
        ordinal_position as "column_index",
        data_type as "column_type",
        comment as "column_comment"
    from {{ information_schema }}.columns
{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt_snowflake.py_script_comment.macro_sql:
{% macro py_script_comment()%}
# To run this in snowsight, you need to select entry point to be main
# And you may have to modify the return type to text to get the result back
# def main(session):
#     dbt = dbtObj(session.table)
#     df = model(dbt, session)
#     return df.collect()

# to run this in local notebook, you need to create a session following examples https://github.com/Snowflake-Labs/sfguide-getting-started-snowpark-python
# then you can do the following to run model
# dbt = dbtObj(session.table)
# df = model(dbt, session)
{%endmacro%}

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_string_as_ti.name: default__snapshot_string_as_time

macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.name: snapshot_staging_table

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_staging_tabl.name: default__snapshot_staging_table
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_staging_tabl.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_staging_table(strategy, source_sql, target_relation) -%}

    with snapshot_query as (

        {{ source_sql }}

    ),

    snapshotted_data as (

        select *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key

        from {{ target_relation }}
        where dbt_valid_to is null

    ),

    insertions_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            nullif({{ strategy.updated_at }}, {{ strategy.updated_at }}) as dbt_valid_to,
            {{ strategy.scd_id }} as dbt_scd_id

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    updates_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_to

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}

    deletes_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key
        from snapshot_query
    ),
    {% endif %}

    insertions as (

        select
            'insert' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*

        from insertions_source_data as source_data
        left outer join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is null
           or (
                snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is not null
            and (
                {{ strategy.row_changed }}
            )
        )

    ),

    updates as (

        select
            'update' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from updates_source_data as source_data
        join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where (
            {{ strategy.row_changed }}
        )
    )

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes -%}
    ,

    deletes as (

        select
            'delete' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_to,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from snapshotted_data
        left join deletes_source_data as source_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where source_data.dbt_unique_key is null
    )
    {%- endif %}

    select * from insertions
    union all
    select * from updates
    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}
    union all
    select * from deletes
    {%- endif %}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt.build_snapshot_table.name: build_snapshot_table

macro.dbt.default__build_snapshot_table.name: default__build_snapshot_table

macro.dbt.build_snapshot_staging_table.name: build_snapshot_staging_table

macro.dbt.snapshot_merge_sql.name: snapshot_merge_sql

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.name: default__snapshot_merge_sql
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_merge_sql(target, source, insert_cols) -%}
    {%- set insert_cols_csv = insert_cols | join(', ') -%}

    merge into {{ target }} as DBT_INTERNAL_DEST
    using {{ source }} as DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE
    on DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_scd_id = DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_scd_id

    when matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_valid_to is null
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type in ('update', 'delete')
        then update
        set dbt_valid_to = DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_valid_to

    when not matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'insert'
        then insert ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
        values ({{ insert_cols_csv }})

{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_relation_tags.name: get_dbt_relation_tags
macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_relation_tags.description:
Find all column tags of the given relation (aka. model)

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set tags = dbt_tags.get_dbt_relation_tags(relation=<your_value>) %}

```

**Output Dict**: `tags` will result as a dict which represented for 1 dbt column tag
```json
{
  "level": <resource_type>, 
  "name": <model name>, 
  "tag": <dbt model tag>
}
```

arguments.name: relation
arguments.description: Model object (extracted from `graph` variable) of the given model

arguments.name: inc_column
arguments.description: Disable to `false` if we don't want to extract the column tags as well

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__get_dbt_relation.name: default__get_dbt_relation_tags

macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_tags.name: get_dbt_tags
macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_tags.description:
Loops through `graph` variable to find all (allowed) dbt tags at the model level as well as the column one.
Note: Allowed dbt tags are controlled by the `dbt_tags__allowed_tags` variable, [] by default which means all allowed

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set tags = dbt_tags.get_dbt_tags() %}

```

**Output**: `tags` will result as list of dict, 1 item will represent for 1 dbt tag as below:
```json
{
  "level": <str indicates model or column level>,
  "name": <model name or column name>,
  "tag": <dbt tag name>
}
```

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__get_dbt_tags.name: default__get_dbt_tags

macro.dbt_tags.get_adapter_tags.name: get_adapter_tags
macro.dbt_tags.get_adapter_tags.description:
Find all column tags in DWH

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set tags = dbt_tags.get_adapter_tags(ns=<your schema namespace>) %}

```

**Output**: List of full qualified tag names

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__get_adapter_tags.name: default__get_adapter_tags

macro.dbt_tags.is_allowed_tags.name: is_allowed_tags
macro.dbt_tags.is_allowed_tags.description:
Check if dbt tag is allowed to be persisted in DWH, configured by `dbt_tags__allowed_tags` variable.

All dbt tags are allowed by default

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set is_allowed = dbt_tags.is_allowed_tags(tag_key=<your_value>) %}

```

macro.dbt_tags.default__is_allowed_tags.name: default__is_allowed_tags

macro.dbt_tags.get_masking_policy_for_ta.name: get_masking_policy_for_tag
macro.dbt_tags.get_masking_policy_for_ta.description:
Check if a masking policy macro corresponding to a configured tag is existed
If it is, return the masking policy macro. Otherwise, raise a warning and return blank

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set mp = dbt_tags.get_masking_policy_for_tag(tag_key=<your_value>) %}

```

macro.dbt_tags.default__get_masking_poli.name: default__get_masking_policy_for_tag

macro.dbt_tags.get_resource_ns.name: get_resource_ns
macro.dbt_tags.get_resource_ns.description:
Get the full qualified name (FQN) of the schema where the resources (tags, masking policies) are persisted to.

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set ns = dbt_tags.get_resource_ns() %}

```

macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_column_tags.name: get_dbt_column_tags
macro.dbt_tags.get_dbt_column_tags.description:
Find all column tags of the given relation (aka. model)

**Usage**:
```sql

{% set tags = dbt_tags.get_dbt_column_tags(relation=<your_value>) %}

```

**Output Dict**: `tags` will result as a dict which represented for 1 dbt column tag
```json
{
  "level": <resource_type.model_name.column>, 
  "name": <column name>, 
  "tag": <dbt column tag>
}
```

arguments.name: relation
arguments.description: Model object (extracted from `graph` variable) of the given model

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__get_dbt_column_t.name: default__get_dbt_column_tags

macro.dbt_tags.unapply_mps_from_tags.name: unapply_mps_from_tags
macro.dbt_tags.unapply_mps_from_tags.description:
Used on-demand via `dbt run-operation`!

Looking for all adapter tags in the schema, for each tag:
- Assign a dummy masking policy (1) to tag (with force)
- Unset that (1) on tag
- Drop (1)

**Usage**
```bash
dbt run-operation unapply_mps_from_tags
dbt run-operation unapply_mps_from_tags --args '{debug: true}'
dbt run-operation unapply_mps_from_tags --args '{ns: "database.schema", debug: true}'
```

arguments.name: ns
arguments.description: Targeted schema namespace if specified. Otherwise get value from `get_resource_ns` macro

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__unapply_mps_from.name: default__unapply_mps_from_tags

macro.dbt_tags.apply_column_tags.name: apply_column_tags
macro.dbt_tags.apply_column_tags.description:
Used in the model's post-hook.

Looking for all tags at all columns in the model, set the (allowed) dbt tags as the adapter tags to the configured column:
- Tag Key: dbt tag name
- Tag Value: dbt column name
Note: To unapply the tags, let's simply re-create the table/view!

**Usage** in `dbt_project.yml` file:
```

models:
  jaffle_shop:
    post-hook:
      - >
        {% if flags.WHICH in ('run', 'build') %}
          {{ dbt_tags.apply_column_tags() }}
        {% endif %}

```

macro.dbt_tags.default__apply_column_tag.name: default__apply_column_tags

macro.dbt_tags.apply_mps_to_tags.name: apply_mps_to_tags
macro.dbt_tags.apply_mps_to_tags.description:
Used on-demand via `dbt run-operation`!

Looking for all column tags in the schema, for each tag:
- Assign a corresponding masking policy (same name with tag) to tag (with force)

**Usage**
```bash
dbt run-operation apply_mps_to_tags
dbt run-operation apply_mps_to_tags --args '{debug: true}'
dbt run-operation apply_mps_to_tags --args '{ns: "database.schema", debug: true}'
```

arguments.name: ns
arguments.description: Targeted schema namespace if specified. Otherwise get value from `get_resource_ns` macro

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__apply_mps_to_tag.name: default__apply_mps_to_tags

macro.dbt_tags.drop_tags.name: drop_tags
macro.dbt_tags.drop_tags.description:
Used as a dbt operation.

Looking for all adapter tags in the schema, drop all tags with automatically removing masking policy if any.
Note: Dropping the tags will explicitly remove the corresponding column's tags

**Usage**:
```bash
dbt run-opertion drop_tags [--args '{debug: true}']
```

**Permission**: Requires to have `APPLY MASKING POLICY` privileges on account:
  ```sql
  
  grant apply masking policy on account to role {{ target.role }};
  
  ```

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__drop_tags.name: default__drop_tags

macro.dbt_tags.create_tags.name: create_tags
macro.dbt_tags.create_tags.description:
Used as a dbt operation.

Looking for all tags at all models and all columns, create the (allowed) dbt tags as the adapter tags.

**Usage**:
```bash
dbt run-opertion create_tags [--args '{debug: true}']
```

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__create_tags.name: default__create_tags

macro.dbt_tags.create_masking_policies.name: create_masking_policies
macro.dbt_tags.create_masking_policies.description:
Find all dbt tags and create the corresponding tag-name-based masking policy definition (if defined).

Ignore creation if cannot find the masking policy DDL's macro.

The DDL macros should be created by yourself in `/macros` directory.
For example, check at `infintelambda/dbt-tags` within `(repo)/integration_tests/macros/mp-ddl`.

**Usage**:
```bash
dbt run-operation create_masking_policies --args '{debug: true}'
```

> Remove `--args '{debug: true}'` for a live run

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Enable to `true` for printing more info for debugging purpose

macro.dbt_tags.default__create_masking_p.name: default__create_masking_policies

doc.dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
doc.dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.
